ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is generally found from sea level to 900 m or, in central Kamchatka, as a zone between 350–800 m.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/66629f9f-cc81-48c0-a8da-f1cd4a89a1ef/713 Kamchatka-Kurile meadows and sparse forests - Natalia Kollegova.jpg

ecoregions.title: Kamchatka Taiga
ecoregions.dek: Between the Sredinny Mountain Range and the Vostochny Ridge, lies the Central Kamchatka Depression.

children.name: East Eurasian Coastal Tundra (PA5)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/84af86ff-b74c-4b1f-9ded-43b212a29e6e/783 Wrangel Island Arctic Desert Boris Solovyev CC4.jpg
86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/a1dcab8c-5a0e-4509-8b2d-f3dfe8471510/783 Wrangel Island Arctic Desert Boris Solovyev CC6.jpg
86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/2c4ce581-12cc-426b-b4c0-b4ca5f5e3ea7/783 Wrangel Island Arctic Desert Boris Solovyev CC1.jpg
86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/e3c176dd-7401-443d-81ac-10366d2287a1/783 Wrangel Island Arctic Desert Boris Solovyev CC3.jpg

children.content:
The East Eurasian Coastal Tundra bioregion is located in the Subarctic Eurasia realm (northern Palearctic) and contains three ecoregions—Chukchi Peninsula Tundra (772), Russian Bering Tundra (779), Wrangel Island Arctic Desert (783)—totaling approximately 78 million hectares of land area. 

Learn more about each of the East Eurasian Coastal Tundra ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Wrangel Island Arctic Desert
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion has unique ancient steppe and tundra vegetation, providing insight into life during Pleistocene times.

ecoregions.title: Russian Bering Tundra
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion stretches between the Kolyma Mountains to the west, the Bering Sea coast to the east, and the Kamchatka peninsula to the south. The climate of the region is subarctic, influenced by the Pacific monsoon.

ecoregions.title: Chukchi Peninsula Tundra
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion stretches from the Kolyma rivermouth to Cape Dezhnev, the easternmost point of mainland Asia.

children.name: Siberian Boreal Forests & Mountain Tundra (PA7)
children.content:
The Siberian Boreal Forests & Mountain Tundra bioregion is part of the Siberia & East Boreal Forests subrealm located in the Subarctic Eurasia realm (northern Palearctic) and contains six ecoregions—East Siberian Taiga (710), Northeast Siberian Taiga (714), Trans-Baikal Conifer Forests (718), West Siberian Taiga (720), Cherskii-Kolyma Mountain Tundra (771), Trans-Baikal Bald Mountain Tundra (782)—totaling nearly 769 million hectares of land area. 

Learn more about each of the Siberian Boreal Forests & Mountain Tundra ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Trans-Baikal Bald Mountain Tundra
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is located along a chain of mountaintops running from the northern edge of Lake Baikal to the coast of the Okhotsk Sea—a series of islands amongst the East Siberian and Okhotsk-Manchurian taiga that form a trans-Siberian route for plant dispersion.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/f5aa2cea-f332-4aee-addd-38cb47da20bf/782 Trans-Baikal Bald Mountain tundra - И Ольховский.jpg

ecoregions.title: Cherskii-Kolyma Mountain Tundra
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion consists of numerous montane areas above the tree line, including the Verkhoyansk, Cherskiy, Ulakhan-Chistay, Moma, and Kolyma mountain ranges, spread within the Northeast Siberian Taiga ecoregion.

ecoregions.title: West Siberian Taiga
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion stretches from the Ural Mountains in the west to the Yenisei River in the east.

ecoregions.title: Trans-Baikal Conifer Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is centered on the Yablonoi and Khentii Mountains, straddling the border between Russia and Mongolia.

ecoregions.title: Northeast Siberian Taiga
ecoregions.dek: One of the coldest places on earth, this ecoregion has vast areas of pristine larch forest, tundra-bogs and wild coastlines, vital for a wide diversity of animals.

ecoregions.title: East Siberian Taiga
ecoregions.dek: This truly vast area is bordered by the Yenisei River to the west and the Verkhoyansk, Kolyma and Dzhugdzhur Mountain ranges to the east.

children.name: Great Britain, Ireland & Faroe Islands (PA9)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/1ca1fc5b-bc86-4970-aaf5-42364f1e84e5/672 North Atlantic moist mixed forests - NPWS_resized.jpg
86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/8112c08d-5a0d-437a-9e44-2026b084dc5a/729 Faroe Islands Boreal Grasslands Eric Welch cc.jpg

children.content:
The Great Britain, Ireland & Faroe Islands bioregion is part of the Anglo-Celtic Isles subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains five ecoregions—Celtic Broadleaf Forests [651], English Lowlands Beech Forests [663], North Atlantic Moist Mixed Forests [672], Caledon Conifer Forests [691], Faroe Islands Boreal Grasslands [729]—totaling nearly 32 million hectares of land area. 

Learn more about each of the Great Britain, Ireland & Faroe Islands ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Faroe Islands Boreal Grasslands
ecoregions.dek: The Faroe Islands are an archipelago of 18 mountainous islands, of which only one is uninhabited, located in the North Atlantic Ocean between Scotland, Norway, and Iceland.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/abdf4d1e-b517-4d43-b779-3bf5c324ab9d/729 Faroe Islands boreal grasslands - Jacqueline Macou.jpg

ecoregions.title: Caledon Conifer Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion covers upland Scotland, encompassing the Northwest Highlands, Grampian, and Cairngorm Mountains.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/310eabc0-9081-4d8b-b3fb-2ea582e5657a/691 Caledon Conifer Forests Erik Fitxpatrick cc.jpg

ecoregions.title: North Atlantic Moist Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is restricted to areas in southwest and west Ireland, the western side of Scotland, including the Outer Hebrides, the far north of Scotland, and the Northern Isles (Orkney and Shetland).

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/1ca1fc5b-bc86-4970-aaf5-42364f1e84e5/672 North Atlantic moist mixed forests - NPWS_resized.jpg

ecoregions.title: English Lowlands Beech Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion encompasses the lowlands in the southeastern part of Britain.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/5ed1d213-3855-43b5-9c93-2fe293f5aec0/663 English Lowlands beech forests - Roman Grac.jpg

ecoregions.title: Celtic Broadleaf Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion covers the majority of Ireland, the eastern half of Northern Ireland, the eastern edge and south of Scotland and the majority of England, excluding the English Lowlands Beech Forests in the south and east.

children.name: European Interior Mixed Forests (PA12)
children.content:
The European Interior Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the Greater European Forests subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains three ecoregions—Central European Mixed Forests (654), East European Forest Steppe (661), Western European Broadleaf Forests (686)—totaling approximately 195.5 million hectares of land area. 

Learn more about each of the European Interior Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Western European Broadleaf Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion covers a large part of Western Europe, including the upland areas of massif central, central German uplands, Jura mountains, Bavarian plateau, and Bohemium massif.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/174ba189-2402-41a1-8fe0-9ae30e0bf0d5/686 Western European Broadleaf Forests SusiMarx cc.jpg

ecoregions.title: East European Forest Steppe
ecoregions.dek: The majority of this ecoregion lies within the Russian Federation, extending into Ukraine, Moldova, the Carpathian foothills in Romania, and finally the Northeastern corner of Bulgaria.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/84989fdd-7363-45c3-913a-3a83b7b4aef2/661 East European forest steppe - sashok1975 Александр.jpg

ecoregions.title: Central European Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: Traversing the lowland plains of Northern Europe, this ecoregion spans large areas of Poland, Belarus, Lithuania, and Ukraine; small portions extend into Germany, Romania, Moldova, Austria, and the Russian Federation.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/4551fe1a-88b7-4b31-a33a-21564c3b6146/654 Central European mixed forests - Robert Pastryk.jpg

children.name: Baltic Sea & Sarmatic Mixed Forests (PA11)
children.content:
The Baltic Sea & Sarmatic Mixed Forests bioregion is located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic) and contains one single ecoregion—Sarmatic Mixed Forests (679)—totaling nearly 85 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about the Baltic Sea & Sarmatic Mixed Forests ecoregion below.

ecoregions.title: Sarmatic Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: These mixed forests cover the entirety of Latvia and Estonia, reaching into Belarus, Lithuania, Sweden, southwesternmost Finland, southernmost Norway, and the Russian Federation.

children.name: West European Coastal Mixed Forests (PA10)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/750bcaa2-e2a6-4127-83c2-393e3e5791b1/648 Cantabrian Mixed Forests Lourdes Cardenal cc.jpg

children.content:
The West European Coastal Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the Greater European Forests subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains four ecoregions—Baltic Mixed Forests (647), Cantabrian Mixed Forests (648), European Atlantic Mixed Forests (664), Pyrenees Conifer and Mixed Forests (676)—totaling more than 62 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the West European Coastal Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Pyrenees Conifer and Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: At the junction of Mediterranean and Central Europe lies a landscape sparsely covered by conifer and mixed forests, stretching up the slopes of the Pyrenees mountains.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/85c0d1d1-5af4-4543-8e1c-54dd4f62f255/676 Pyrenees conifer and mixed forests - David Mark.jpg

ecoregions.title: European Atlantic Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is located at the western coast of the Eurasian continent, extending from the south of France up to the northern most tip of Denmark.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/641a2829-fe31-481e-9261-0c0199c53746/664 European Atlantic mixed forests - David Mark.jpg

ecoregions.title: Cantabrian Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion encompasses the Atlantic coast from the northern half of Portugal, across northern Spain to La Rochelle in France.

ecoregions.title: Baltic Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: The Baltic Mixed Forests stretch eastwards along the Baltic coastline from Denmark to northern Germany and Poland, and include the southernmost part of Sweden.

children.name: Dinaric Mountains & Balkan Mixed Forests (PA15)
children.content:
The Dinaric Mountains & Balkan Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the European Mountain Forests subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains three ecoregions—Balkan Mixed Forests (646), Dinaric Mountains Mixed Forests (660), Rodope Montane Mixed Forests (678)—totaling approximately 31.5 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the Dinaric Mountains & Balkan Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Rodope Montane Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: The Rodope Montane Mixed Forests ecoregion encompasses the Balkan massif and Rhodope massif.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/dd3526ce-de3e-4d62-aebc-69dbe3445f46/678 Rodope montane mixed forests - Mechit Musala.jpg

ecoregions.title: Dinaric Mountains Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: Spanning across the north-eastern coastline of Adriatic Sea in Eastern Europe, this ecoregion represents one of the largest and most continuous tracts of forested habitats for large carnivores in the continent.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/ab84d733-20ef-4882-974a-8c8ef5a02225/660 Dinaric Mountains mixed forests - Malcolm Carlaw.jpg

ecoregions.title: Balkan Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion covers much of Bulgaria, Kosovo, North Macedonia, southern Serbia and Romania, and the northernmost parts of Greece and Turkey, stretching from the Black Sea towards the Adriatic.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/709b57e9-7158-4a8b-9f52-ff1506b37a0c/646 Balkan mixed forests - Konstantin Korlev alternative.jpg

children.name: Alps & Po Basin Mixed Forests (PA13)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/bfb6c31f-8b49-46dd-aa8a-a266fc1fe45d/689 Alp conifer and mixed forest - Kordula Vahle.jpg
86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/6524fdd7-324b-4322-99b4-e7ba7bb4c486/689 Alps Conifer and Mixed Ju2kiwi cc.jpg
86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/e2076faa-6e53-49ff-928b-c990158c4b2a/689 Alps Conifer and Mixed Nuno Alves cc.jpg

children.content:
The Alps & Po Basin Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the European Mountain Forests subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains two ecoregions—Po Basin Mixed Forests [675], Alps Conifer and Mixed Forests [689]—totaling more than 19 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the Alps & Po Basin Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Alps Conifer and Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: Located in Central Europe, the Alps stretch across seven countries: France, Italy, Germany, Austria, Slovenia, Switzerland, and Liechtenstein.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/5c3ded83-cef0-4097-8c1c-845ec29f11db/689 Alps Conifer and Mixed Forests Rainerax cc.jpg

ecoregions.title: Po Basin Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: Found scattered throughout one of the most industrialized regions in Europe are the last remaining pockets of riparian woodlands and wetlands.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/4e5f03ea-0988-461d-8500-07c22194a153/675 Po Basin mixed forests - Enrico Castello.jpg

children.name: Carpathian Mountain & Plains Mixed Forests (PA14)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/f86e4df6-4886-4a63-aa7c-de22b9a85a3c/674 Pannonian Mixed Forests Tomáš Merta cc.jpg

children.content:
The Carpathian Mountain & Plains Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the European Mountain Forests subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains two ecoregions—Pannonian Mixed Forests (674), Carpathian Montane Forests (692)—totaling more than 42 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the Carpathian Mountain & Plains Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Carpathian Montane Forests
ecoregions.dek: The Carpathian Mountain chain forms an arc across Central and Eastern Europe. 54% of the range lies within Romania, with the rest traversing the Czech Republic, Poland, Slovakia, and Ukraine.

ecoregions.title: Pannonian Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion covers the entirety of Hungary, and is only in part of other Central European countries.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/f86e4df6-4886-4a63-aa7c-de22b9a85a3c/674 Pannonian Mixed Forests Tomáš Merta cc.jpg

children.name: Black Sea, Caucasus-Anatolian Mixed Forests & Steppe (PA17)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/93519e14-d636-4276-a479-66a573ad4153/652 Central Anatolian Steppe and Woodlands Semih Ekinci cc.jpg

children.content:
The Black Sea, Caucasus-Anatolian Mixed Forests & Steppe bioregion is part of the Black Sea Forests & Steppe subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains seven ecoregions—Caucasus Mixed Forests (650), Central Anatolian Steppe and Woodlands (652), Crimean Submediterranean Forest Complex (658), Eastern Anatolian Deciduous Forests (662), Euxine-Colchic Broadleaf Forests (665), Northern Anatolian Conifer and Deciduous Forests (703), Central Anatolian Steppe (725)—totaling approximately 58.5 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the Black Sea, Caucasus-Anatolian Mixed Forests & Steppe ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Central Anatolian Steppe
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is comprised of five distinct areas in the Central Anatolian region of Turkey.

ecoregions.title: Northern Anatolian Conifer and Deciduous Forests
ecoregions.dek: These forests sprawl across the southern slopes of the Pontic Mountains, a vast range that sweeps across the Northern Anatolia region of Turkey.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/26b0a55c-fb4c-4843-b500-4f8440bc7997/703 Northern Anatolian conifer and deciduous forests - yusuf kazancı.jpg

ecoregions.title: Euxine-Colchic Broadleaf Forests
ecoregions.dek: These lush forests span the southern shoreline of the Black Sea, from the Southeasternmost corner of Bulgaria, across the Northern coastline of Turkey, and into lowland Georgia.

ecoregions.title: Eastern Anatolian Deciduous Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion lies within Turkey’s Anatolian plateau, ranging over the Western part of the East Anatolian Mountains.

ecoregions.title: Crimean Submediterranean Forest Complex
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is formed by two coastal enclaves on the Northern coast of the Black Sea.

ecoregions.title: Central Anatolian Steppe and Woodlands
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion occupies Central Turkey, bounded by the Pontic Mountains in the North and the Taurus Mountains in the South.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/813cfd28-36a8-485a-ba7f-d2134a02bab3/652 Central Anatolian steppe and woodlands - Haydar Tamer Ozturk.jpg

ecoregions.title: Caucasus Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion follows the Greater and Lesser Caucasus Mountain ranges, spanning five countries: Georgia, Russia, Azerbaijan, Turkey, and Armenia.

children.name: Pontic Steppe Grasslands (PA16)
children.content:
The Pontic Steppe Grasslands bioregion is part of the Black Sea Forests & Steppe subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains one single ecoregion—Pontic Steppe (735)—totaling approximately 99.5 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about the Pontic Steppe Grasslands ecoregion below.

ecoregions.title: Pontic Steppe
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion arises in the northeasternmost corner of Bulgaria, extending across Southeast Romania, Southeast Moldova, Southeast Ukraine, through Russia, and into Northwest Kazakhstan.

children.name: Adriatic Sea & Central Mediterranean Mixed Forests (PA19)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/aa55ea53-6c63-4ef5-a938-af2bd702315e/806 Tyrrhenian-Adriatic sclerophyllous and mixed forests - valtercirillo.jpg

children.content:
The Adriatic Sea & Central Mediterranean Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the Mediterranean subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains six ecoregions—Apennine Deciduous Montane Forests (644), Corsican Montane Broadleaf and Mixed Forests (788), Illyrian Deciduous Forests (794), Italian Sclerophyllous and Semi-Deciduous Forests (795), South Apennine Mixed Montane Forests (802), Tyrrhenian-Adriatic Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests (806)—totaling approximately 26 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the Adriatic Sea & Central Mediterranean Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Tyrrhenian-Adriatic Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion extends along the coastal lowlands of the southern half of the Italian Peninsula, Sicily, and Corsica.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/aa55ea53-6c63-4ef5-a938-af2bd702315e/806 Tyrrhenian-Adriatic sclerophyllous and mixed forests - valtercirillo.jpg

ecoregions.title: South Apennine Mixed Montane Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is restricted to the high mountain massifs of the Italian regions of Basilicata, Calabria, and the island of Sicily.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/2bb27ff2-05a9-450f-825b-dc8ea3af0b12/802 South Apennine mixed montane forests - Valter Cirillo.jpg

ecoregions.title: Italian Sclerophyllous and Semi-Deciduous Forests
ecoregions.dek: The Italian Sclerophyllous and Semi-Deciduous Forests ecoregion covers the Italian peninsular from southeast France, south of the Po Plain to Basilicata in southern Italy.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/1c5bf707-4184-43b1-af1c-19775007ef13/795 Italian sclerophyllous and semi-deciduous forests - Valter Cirillo.jpg

ecoregions.title: Illyrian Deciduous Forests
ecoregions.dek: The ecoregion extends all along the coastal ranges of the Eastern Adriatic coast, from the eastern Alps in northern Italy to the northern Ionian coast between Albania and Greece.

ecoregions.title: Corsican Montane Broadleaf and Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is restricted to the high and steep mountain massifs of Corsica Island, the fourth largest island in the Mediterranean Sea.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/75b6918a-0a04-4017-b04a-3c614090c7c5/788 Corsican montane broadleaf and mixed forests - Tom Chirossel.jpg

ecoregions.title: Appenine Deciduous Montane Forests
ecoregions.dek: Tucked away among the peaks of Italy’s Apennine mountains, which stretch from the Alps down to Sicily, are some of Europe’s best-preserved forests and montane grasslands.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/5c857378-7ce3-4ccd-a1dc-692c7d95ace1/644 Appenine deciduous montane forests - Valter Cirillo.jpg

children.name: Aegean Sea & East Mediterranean Mixed Forests (PA18)
children.content:
The Aegean Sea & East Mediterranean Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the Mediterranean subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains seven ecoregions—Aegean and Western Turkey Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests (785), Anatolian Conifer and Deciduous Mixed Forests (786), Crete Mediterranean Forests (789), Cyprus Mediterranean Forests (790), Eastern Mediterranean Conifer-Broadleaf Forests (791), Pindus Mountains Mixed Forests (801), Southern Anatolian Montane Conifer and Deciduous Forests (804)—totaling approximately 49.5 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the Aegean Sea & East Mediterranean Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Southern Anatolian Montane Conifer and Deciduous Forests
ecoregions.dek: The majority of this landscape stretches across the Southern Anatolia region of Turkey, reaching into the highlands of Lebanon, Syria, and a very small area in Israel.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/fbca4b63-198f-4a8c-b783-fc20a020e933/804 Southern Anatolian Montane Conifer and Deciduous Forests.jpg

ecoregions.title: Pindus Mountains Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: The ecoregion extends in a north-south direction from the mountain ranges of the Peloponese to the central Greek Parnasos, Smolikas, and Olympus, to northern Albania and western North Macedonia.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/8aeba949-e17e-4c67-9db0-ac212af7e397/801 Pindus Mountains mixed forests - Michel Mondadori.jpg

ecoregions.title: Eastern Mediterranean Conifer-Broadleaf Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion spans the Mediterranean coastline of the Middle East, running through Turkey, Lebanon, Israel, Palestine, Jordan, and the Syrian Arab Republic.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/68136802-3ae5-41cd-b03e-c9abb1691b01/791 Eastern Mediterranean conifer-broadleaf forests - Tuna Olger.jpg

ecoregions.title: Cyprus Mediterranean Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion covers the entire area of the Republic of Cyprus, the third largest island in the Mediterranean.

ecoregions.title: Crete Mediterranean Forests
ecoregions.dek: Crete is the fifth largest island of the Mediterranean Basin and the ecoregion which encapsulates the whole island is restricted to high mountain ranges , hills, and low plains of the island.

ecoregions.title: Anatolian Conifer and Deciduous Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This transitional ecoregion lies within Western Turkey, hosting a confluence of Mediterranean, Euro-Siberian, and Irano-Turanian flora.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/68e6ba77-e52a-4e43-a2b4-7a61c9513aec/786 Anatolian conifer and deciduous mixed forests - RÜŞTÜ BOZKUŞ.jpg

ecoregions.title: Aegean and Western Turkey Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion stretches mostly across Greece and Western Turkey, reaching into Southeast Macedonia, and Bulgaria; it encompasses many of the Aegean and Cyclades islands.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/796c9759-af3b-43a7-94d8-da1171a6a48c/785 Aegean and Western Turkey sclerophyllous and mixed forests - Dimitris Vetsikas.jpg

children.name: Azores Forest Islands (PA21)
children.content:
The Azores Forest Islands bioregion is part of the Mediterranean subrealm located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). it contains one single ecoregion—Azores Temperate Mixed Forests (645)—totaling approximately 262 thousand hectares of land area.

Learn more about the Azores Forest Islands ecoregion below.

ecoregions.title: Azores Temperate Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: Situated more than 1,350 km west of the Portuguese coast, the Azores archipelago is a collection of several small volcanic islands

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/ef1f5a50-7292-45ee-a485-67d66dc6c265/645 Azores temperate mixed forests - Sandro Porto.jpg

children.name: Balearic Sea & West Mediterranean Mixed Forests (PA20)

images.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/faf28758-b8d1-4e56-91af-92deb8e43291/803 Southeast Iberian shrubs and woodlands - ziegler175.jpg
86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/11c89992-57e7-414a-9775-4dff0d278c3d/805 Southwest Iberian Mediterranean Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests Husond cc.jpg

children.content:
The Balearic Sea & West Mediterranean Mixed Forests bioregion is part of the Mediterranean subrealm and located in the Western Eurasia realm (western Palearctic). It contains six ecoregions—Iberian Conifer Forests (792), Iberian Sclerophyllous and Semi-Deciduous Forests (793), Northeastern Spain and Southern, France Mediterranean Forests (799), Northwest Iberian Montane Forests (800), Southeastern Iberian Shrubs and Woodlands (803), Southwest Iberian Mediterranean Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests (805)—totaling approximately 55.5 million hectares of land area.

Learn more about each of the Balearic Sea & West Mediterranean Mixed Forests ecoregions below.

ecoregions.title: Southwest Iberian Mediterranean Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion extends all along the low elevations, valleys, plains, and Atlantic coastal strip of the southwestern part of the Iberian Peninsula.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/aa17b647-d9dd-464a-954b-30e80424eaf9/805 Southwest Iberian Mediterranean Sclerophyllous and Mixed Forests El Pantera cc.jpg

ecoregions.title: Southeastern Iberian Shrubs and Woodlands
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion is restricted to a narrow strip of land on the south-eastern coast of Spain from Almería to Los Alcazares with a small addition just south of Murcia.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/ea8a1692-0e45-4f02-a4e9-2abc5e4f63b1/803 Southeastern Iberian Shrubs and Woodlands Nano Sanchez cc.jpg

ecoregions.title: Northwest Iberian Montane Forests
ecoregions.dek: The northwestern Iberian Mountains extend from the Mediterranean southern slopes of the Cantabric Mountains to the central Iberian high mountain range.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/aa7d5850-90d8-44df-a40b-84fa65e6e2bb/800 Northwest Iberian montane forests - António Cascalheira.jpg

ecoregions.title: Northeastern Spain and Southern France Mediterranean Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion encompasses Southern France, the coastal part of Valencia and Catalonia regions in North-eastern Spain, and the Balearic Islands.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/618cf98d-bc73-4a6d-a4c1-f3badcc4906e/799 Northeastern Spain and Southern France Mediterranean Forests Joan Banjo cc.jpeg

ecoregions.title: Iberian Sclerophyllous and Semi-Deciduous Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion covers the central plateaus, valleys, and low plains of the interior portion of the Iberian Peninsula.

image.path: 86ce9525-f5f2-4e97-81ba-54e8ce933da7/dev/8b38b517-509b-471a-a169-fdd7c8bce44c/793 Iberian sclerophyllous and semi-deciduous forests - António Cascalheira.jpg

ecoregions.title: Iberian Conifer Forests
ecoregions.dek: This ecoregion spreads geographically all along the main central eastern and southeastern mountain ranges of Spain.
